title: Malin Akerman enjoys a sunny Saturday at the pumpkin patch
text:
Malin Akerman got a head start on Halloween on Saturday as she was spotted on an afternoon jaunt to the Underwood Family Farms pumpkin patch in Moorpark, Calif. alongside her husband Jack Donnelly.

The Couples Retreat star donned a wide-brimmed fedora, a grey burnout tank top, skintight jeggings and black boots for the sunny outing.

Akerman, 41, stepped out sans makeup to reveal a clear and bright natural complexion.

Family day out: Malin Akerman got a head start on Halloween on Saturday as she was spotted on an afternoon jaunt to the Underwood Family Farms pumpkin patch in Moorpark, Calif. alongside her husband Jack Donnelly and six-year-old son Sebastian

Her actor husband wore a collared denim shirt with a frayed hem and a pair of black jeans.

The pair announced their engagement in October 2017 and walked down the aisle in Tulum, Mexico the following year.

Akerman shares six-year-old son Sebastian with Italian musician ex-husband Roberto Zincone.

Happy: The Couples Retreat star donned a wide-brimmed fedora, a grey burnout tank top, skintight jeggings and black boots for the sunny outing

She opened up to Bravo in 2017 on her relationship with Sebastian and the activities they share together.

When asked about his interests, Akerman said: 'He’s more into inventions. If we were to put a video on, he’d be excited to watch a paper mill and how paper is made.

'He wants to know how things are made. Usually, a lot of the stuff we play with are: gears that we can put together, or wires that get put together that you can switch the lights on and off, or magnetic putty, and making things out of that. He loves magic tricks, and inventions and science projects, and those kinds of things.'

Casual: Akerman, 41, stepped out sans makeup to reveal a clear and bright natural complexion

And although Akerman has at least 63 film and TV credits to her name, she keeps little Sebastian out of the loop.

'He hasn’t seen really any of my stuff,' she said. 'He’s seen an interview or two of mine. I’ve had some things where I sing - I’ve shown him some of those things. But, other than that, the movies that I’ve done: he’s not allowed to watch, ever!'

The Stockholm native recently wrapped filming on Netflix's The Sleepover with Joe Manganiello.

She and Connelly will appear on the big screen together next year in the comedy Friendsgiving co-starring Kat Dennings, Jane Seymour, Christine Taylor, Wanda Sykes and Margaret Cho.
